üîéüêû My mindset as a QAProfessional pessimism?From my point of view, it‚Äôs a positive thing.A QA tester's professional pessimism isn‚Äôt about being demotivated or pessimistic in the classical sense. It‚Äôs about having an unwavering focus on anticipating problems before they visibly manifest! Before they become obstacles to the product‚Äôs success. This ‚Äúwalking on the wrong side‚Äù allows us to identify defects that other teams, often more optimistic, may overlook, especially in a scenario where everyone tends to focus on the positive aspects and the functionalities that are working well. The QA tester adopts a different approach: they put themselves on the ‚Äúwrong side‚Äù of the situation, intentionally looking for gaps that could compromise the user experience or the product‚Äôs performance. Pessimism and success.

üîéüêû My mindset as a QAProfessional pessimism?From my point of view, it‚Äôs a positive thing.A QA tester's professional pessimism isn‚Äôt about being demotivated or pessimistic in the classical sense. It‚Äôs about having an unwavering focus on anticipating problems before they visibly manifest! Before they become obstacles to the product‚Äôs success. This ‚Äúwalking on the wrong side‚Äù allows us to identify defects that other teams, often more optimistic, may overlook, especially in a scenario where everyone tends to focus on the positive aspects and the functionalities that are working well. The QA tester adopts a different approach: they put themselves on the ‚Äúwrong side‚Äù of the situation, intentionally looking for gaps that could compromise the user experience or the product‚Äôs performance. Pessimism and success.

üîéüêû My mindset as a QAProfessional pessimism?From my point of view, it‚Äôs a positive thing.A QA tester's professional pessimism isn‚Äôt about being demotivated or pessimistic in the classical sense. It‚Äôs about having an unwavering focus on anticipating problems before they visibly manifest! Before they become obstacles to the product‚Äôs success. This ‚Äúwalking on the wrong side‚Äù allows us to identify defects that other teams, often more optimistic, may overlook, especially in a scenario where everyone tends to focus on the positive aspects and the functionalities that are working well. The QA tester adopts a different approach: they put themselves on the ‚Äúwrong side‚Äù of the situation, intentionally looking for gaps that could compromise the user experience or the product‚Äôs performance. Pessimism and success.

üîéüêû My mindset as a QAProfessional pessimism?From my point of view, it‚Äôs a positive thing.A QA tester's professional pessimism isn‚Äôt about being demotivated or pessimistic in the classical sense. It‚Äôs about having an unwavering focus on anticipating problems before they visibly manifest! Before they become obstacles to the product‚Äôs success. This ‚Äúwalking on the wrong side‚Äù allows us to identify defects that other teams, often more optimistic, may overlook, especially in a scenario where everyone tends to focus on the positive aspects and the functionalities that are working well. The QA tester adopts a different approach: they put themselves on the ‚Äúwrong side‚Äù of the situation, intentionally looking for gaps that could compromise the user experience or the product‚Äôs performance. Pessimism and success.

üîéüêû My mindset as a QAProfessional pessimism?From my point of view, it‚Äôs a positive thing.A QA tester's professional pessimism isn‚Äôt about being demotivated or pessimistic in the classical sense. It‚Äôs about having an unwavering focus on anticipating problems before they visibly manifest! Before they become obstacles to the product‚Äôs success. This ‚Äúwalking on the wrong side‚Äù allows us to identify defects that other teams, often more optimistic, may overlook, especially in a scenario where everyone tends to focus on the positive aspects and the functionalities that are working well. The QA tester adopts a different approach: they put themselves on the ‚Äúwrong side‚Äù of the situation, intentionally looking for gaps that could compromise the user experience or the product‚Äôs performance. Pessimism and success.

üîéüêû My mindset as a QAProfessional pessimism?From my point of view, it‚Äôs a positive thing.A QA tester's professional pessimism isn‚Äôt about being demotivated or pessimistic in the classical sense. It‚Äôs about having an unwavering focus on anticipating problems before they visibly manifest! Before they become obstacles to the product‚Äôs success. This ‚Äúwalking on the wrong side‚Äù allows us to identify defects that other teams, often more optimistic, may overlook, especially in a scenario where everyone tends to focus on the positive aspects and the functionalities that are working well. The QA tester adopts a different approach: they put themselves on the ‚Äúwrong side‚Äù of the situation, intentionally looking for gaps that could compromise the user experience or the product‚Äôs performance. Pessimism and success.

üîéüêû My mindset as a QAProfessional pessimism?From my point of view, it‚Äôs a positive thing.A QA tester's professional pessimism isn‚Äôt about being demotivated or pessimistic in the classical sense. It‚Äôs about having an unwavering focus on anticipating problems before they visibly manifest! Before they become obstacles to the product‚Äôs success. This ‚Äúwalking on the wrong side‚Äù allows us to identify defects that other teams, often more optimistic, may overlook, especially in a scenario where everyone tends to focus on the positive aspects and the functionalities that are working well. The QA tester adopts a different approach: they put themselves on the ‚Äúwrong side‚Äù of the situation, intentionally looking for gaps that could compromise the user experience or the product‚Äôs performance. Pessimism and success.
